Articles.Content: New (or a larger variety) of inflatable heat shields!

> > > 11 hours ago, Sir\_Fanch said: > > > Lol ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P"). > > > Fantastic mod, Keep up the tremendous work ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D"). > Thanks! You bet. > > > 6 hours ago, COL.R.Neville said: > > > hah yeah you cats seem to be a talented bunch so a few stretch goals for ya, > > > > > 1.2 around the corner forgot antennas will probably be the next cool thing to have. specially tracking ones like remotetech used to have. > > > > > oh and forgot conformal fuel,rcs tanks there used to be a mod i think the name was bft or something like those tanks looked pretty slick. > Antennas we got. Adding 1.2 functionality to them is a grand idea. You're a winner! > > > 2 hours ago, Delta\_8930 said: > > > New (or a larger variety) of inflatable heat shields! > Those things are very tricky! In our blindness from the light, we had not thought much about other sizes for the inflatable. That should be an easy thing to implement. Good idea! > > > 10 hours ago, NeoFatalis said: > > > I think it would be nice to have RealPlume support (Yeah , I know you told that you will not support RO but this is not really RO , and I get that this is a huge amount of work to make configs for all the engines , I just think it would make the whole pack to look better overall , also the stock plumes make me vomit![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")) , If I would know how to write configs I would happily do this myself...(altough it's never too late to try![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P"))... > One kink here is that some of the engines that we are firmly committed to using ( many of them actually ) use the older engine module style and it would be a huge amount of work to re engineer them to support RealPlume... so any implementation we did would always result in "Hey why didn't yo do that across the pack??" Also when we talk about the huge size of the pack, adding data for plumage is a tough sell.

is... is this mod even supported by <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>?
it did before. I removed the X in the cfg name and the game loaded but it was the NON <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> part which was 1/4 size smaller than its supposed to be

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, VenomousRequiem said:
> 
> 
> is... is this mod even supported by <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>?
> 

Yep, [as best as we can](https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealismOverhaul/tree/master/GameData/RealismOverhaul/RO_SuggestedMods/CMES-WIP). And new configs for KSP 1.2 are on the way.

[@shizzak](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/159437-shizzak/) revert the cfg part name change, open the "RO\_CMES\_Pod.cfg" file and go to the line 1022. Replace the "Engines" definition with "Engine" and it should be OK.
those cfg files you have. Is there a way to download them if so. Where would i need to put those files

@phineasfreak where do you place the files?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-07T23:06:33Z" title="10/07/2016 11:06  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 7, 2016</time> by F3ARSTUNTS**

Spoiler

MODULE  

    {          

        name = ModuleAnimateGeneric  

        animationName = KLLDeployAnim  

        startEventGUIName = Lower Leg  

        endEventGUIName = Raise Leg  

        wheelColliderName = wheelCollider  

        suspensionTransformName = Piston  

        orientFootToGround = true  

        landingFootName = FootHing  

        // Axis is aligned forward instead of up  

        alignFootUp = true  

        suspensionUpperLimit = 0.65  

        impactTolerance = 6500  

        suspensionOffset = 0, 0,0  

        suspensionSpring = 5  

        suspensionDamper = 1  

    }

use the above to replace the MODULE {name = ModuleLandingLeg} block to get the ASET Landing Legs going in 1.2.
i don't know if it's a thing yet but maybe real plume for the engines?

I really hope this mod will be updated and won't die![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

I have all the parts in game now need to work on all the cfg's and see what don't work but will put Chaka Monkey on the top of the list to get it fixed up and hoping to get back in touch with @**[YANFRET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/90547-yanfret/ "Go to YANFRET's profile")**
Is there a way to make all the parts appear on 1.2? I have the mod loaded and most parts appear but parts such as the Orion cockpit do not.
So I am trying to use this and there are a whole slew of parts missing, any idea?

Most likely the missing parts are victim to the line with "strut" that needs to be changed to "part"

This was a fairly substantial / unexpected change. But [@MeCripp](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/96203-mecripp/) and several others seem to be looking into it. I would say just be patient and keep an eye on the thread.

has pointed most of the problem out @**[YANFRET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/90547-yanfret/ "Go to YANFRET's profile")**has taken a break from KSP I'm not sure if the mod can be posted in the thread or not and i don't really want to try and make a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> to change all of it so if i can get back in connect with Yanfret i see if i can just update the downlinks

If you would like to assist beta testing 1.2.2 craft send a PM and you will get a dropbox link.
